com.siemens.icm.io
Class DAC

java.lang.Object
  com.siemens.icm.io.DAC
public class DAC
extends Object

The DAC class provides the ability to control the Pulse Width Modulation (PWM) of the Digital Analogue Converter outputs. Six different PWM frequencies are supported: 320Hz, 970Hz, 8125Hz, 16250Hz, 32500Hz and 65000Hz. These frequencies are selected by specifying a value from 0 to 5 in the constructor. The duty cycle can then be changed at any point by calling the setDutyCycle method and giving a duty cycle in percentage from 0 to 100 %.

See Also:
ADC

public DAC(int pwmFreq,
           int startDutyCycle)
Creates a new instance of the DAC class.

Parameters:
pwmFreq - Selects the PWM frequency. Valid values are from 0 to 5.
startDutyCycle - Initial duty cycle in percentage steps. Valid values are from 0 to 100.
